entry.title: Crash with tab groups and selection mode
entry.content:
App Version (from "Chrome Settings > About Chrome"): 126.0.6427.1 canary iOS Version: iOS 17.4.1 Device: iPhone 12 Pro Max
Steps to reproduce: - Have Tab Groups in Grid enabled. chrome://flags#tab-groups-in-grid - Open 2 NTPs. - Go to Tab Grid. - Create a group with the first NTP. - Enter Edit > Select Tabs. - Select the group. - Tab "Close Tab", then "Close 1 Tab". - Don't leave Selection mode and select the remaining NTP. - Tab "Add To…" > "Add Tab to New Group" > "Create Group".
Observed behavior: - Crash. Examples: https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?q=EXISTS+%28SELECT+1+FROM+UNNEST%28CrashedStackTrace.StackFrame%29+WHERE+FunctionName%3D%27TabGroup%3A%3Arange%28%29+const%27%29&stbtiq=&reportid=942fd84c0121a20d&index=0#0
Expected behavior: - No crash and the NTP is moved to the new group.
Frequency: 5/5
Additional comments:

entry.title: Many runs error out with "Bot is dead"
entry.content:
This happens a lot recently. Not knowing the perf impact in advance is pretty much blocking for experimental CLs that shift around heuristics -- which is a large part of tuning for Speedometer3 these days.
E.g. https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/1398d957be0000
The swarming task failed with state "Bot is dead.". This generally indicates that the test was successfully started, but was stopped prematurely. This error could be something like the bot died, the test timed out, or the task was manually canceled.

entry.title: Regression : Background focus is displaying in both square and circle shapes When we mouse over 3 dot
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 126.0.6427.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) 5c513a1b6e4bd664e87dae2bfb086e1c8b6bec5f-refs/branch-heads/6427@{#1}
OS: Mac(14.5 Beta), Win(10,11) and Linux
Precondition : none
1.Launch Chrome and Open NTP and inspect 2.click on recorder and click on new recording 3.click on Start recording and click on stop recording 3.Mouse over 3 dot 4.Observe background focus square and circle shapes are displaying
Actual Result : Background focus is displaying in both square and circle shapes When we mouse over 3 dot
Expected Result : Background focus should be display in only one shape either square or circle When we mouse over 3 dot
This is a regression issue broken in M126, and please find per revision-bisect info below:
Good Build : 126.0.6425.0 Bad Build : 126.0.6426.0
You are probably looking for a change made after 1289157 (known good), but no later than 1289158 (first known bad).
CHANGELOG URL: The script might not always return single CL as suspect as some perf builds might get missing due to failure.
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/4ea25a4d11943305b2d481f17a638070c9adcacf..71bd28ef6b5095b70acc8e1ba7b632d8bedebd50
Suspect : https://chromium.googlesource.com/devtools/devtools-frontend/+/5fda646af7102dfb52e73500d3b2f12ce64edc50
@Alex Rudenko : Could you please check whether this is caused with respect to your change, if not please help us in assigning it to the right owner.
Note: 1. Issue able to repro on latest Canary #126.0.6427.0 2.Issue unable to repro on Stable #123.0.6312.124, Dev #125.0.6420.4, Beta #125.0.6422.4
Kindly refer the attached screenshot link below
Actual Result : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9K8zg5AQMwmFxgz
Expected Result : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4tdLb2KwVWLJ6dR
Thank you..!!

entry.title: Fix potential CHECK crash in SyncServiceImpl::GetTypesWithPendingDownloadForInitialSync()
entry.content:
SyncServiceImpl::GetTypesWithPendingDownloadForInitialSync() [currently assumes](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/sync/service/sync_service_impl.cc;l=1497-1499;drc=80f2670c2914fb61a85b228c7483c56415696e42) that persistent auth errors lead to data_type_manager_ being null.
After crrev.com/c/5396596, that's no longer true. This could result in hitting a CHECK in that method.
In practice, GetTypesWithPendingDownloadForInitialSync() is only used on iOS so far, where persistent auth errors don't really exist so far. So *probably* this isn't an actual issue yet, but we should still fix it ASAP (a) just in case and (b) because both of the "so far"s above won't hold forever.

entry.title: [YOUTUBE][LANDSCAPE MODE] [IOS]"Back chevron button is not clickable while blocking the advertisement"
entry.content:
**Description:** The back chevron button is not clickable while blocking the advertisement in landscape mode.
**Pre Requisite:** Login youtube with valid credential in ios mobile. Open youtube with non premium account
**Steps to repro:** 1.play videos in youtube and it will play some random adds. 2.change your device to landscape mode 3.click on ⓘ U+24D8 and redirect my add centre screen in potrait mode 4.click on block add and click continue button 5.clikc on back chevron which is in top left corner
**Expected result:** It should redirect again to video screen while clicking on back chevron.
**Actual result:** Back chevron button is not clickable and button is overlayed with color UI icon
Is it 100% reproducible : yes
**Note:** Issue is not observed in android device. Report add page is opened in potrait mode instead of landscape.
Attached screenshot and video for reference

entry.title: Regression : Bookmark folder on the bookmarks bar doesn’t open when it is clicked for the first time
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 126.0.6427.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) 5c513a1b6e4bd664e87dae2bfb086e1c8b6bec5f-refs/branch-heads/6427@{#1}
OS : Mac,Win(10,11),Linux
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome 2. Make sure to have any folder on bookmarks bar(either create it/use import) 3. Open NTP 4. Click on the Bookmark folder on the bookmarks bar 5. Observe that it does not open when it is clicked for the first time but opens from second time onwards(can be repro again by doing chrome://restart)
Actual Result: Bookmark folder on the bookmarks bar doesn’t open when it is clicked for the first time
Expected Result: Bookmark folder on the bookmarks bar must open
Please find bisect info below:
This is a regression issue broken in M126, and please find per revision-bisect info below:
Good Build : 126.0.6424.0 Bad Build : 126.0.6425.0
You are probably looking for a change made after 1288682 (known good), but no later than 1288683 (first known bad).
CHANGELOG URL:
The script might not always return single CL as suspect as some perf builds might get missing due to failure.
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/e80b5c00b7d8a6acbdf84657f48d712ac0487cbc..d81352351f602ab6c8f655d789309092005896e7
Suspect: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d81352351f602ab6c8f655d789309092005896e7
@Mikel Astiz: Could you please check whether this is caused with respect to your change, if not please help us in assigning it to the right owner.
Note 1.Issue repro on latest Canary #126.0.6427.0 2.Issue not repro on latest Dev #126.0.6423.2, Beta #125.0.6422.5 and Stable #124.0.6367.62 3.Issue is reproducible on Windows and Linux.
Kindly refer the screencasts attached below
Good Build : https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTgzNzM5MTkwOTYxNzY2NHxkZjllNGQwZS1hMA
Bad Build : https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NDU1MzUwNjAyNjQyMjI3MnwwYmNjZTQzMy0wNg
Thanks!

entry.title: Page offers import of autofilled address
entry.content:
When I autofilled the form https://www.reservecalifornia.com/Web/Customers/NewCustomer.aspx, the website somehow submits the form immediately (issue 335636884) and then offers import for the saved address.
Intuitively, the filled address and the import candidate should be equivalent. Why am I getting asked for an import?
I suspect this is due to the ZIP code, which the Password Manager had erroneously filled (issue 335638867).
chrome://autofill-internals and a "screenshot" (:-)) are attached.
P1 because this might be a bad bug.
Related bugs on the site are issue 335636884, issue 335638867, issue 331125647.

entry.title: Shared process warning is not only shown on paused contexts, cannot be dismissed permanently
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open a page in tab A, open DevTools 2. Open the same page in tab B, open DevTools 3. Confirm that the following warning is displayed at the top: "Other tabs share a process with this tab, which may result in an unexpected DevTools experience." 4. Dismiss the warning, close and reopen DevTools 5. Confirm that the warning is displayed again
# Problem Description The warning was introduced in https://issues.chromium.org/issues/324096747. The implementation does not match the issue description "Provide indication to other local frames why context is paused" because the warning is not only shown when the context is paused, but every time devtools is opened multiple times for the same context.
Additionally there is no option or feature flag to permanently disable the warning via the UI (as far as I can tell).
# Summary Shared process warning is not only shown on paused contexts, cannot be dismissed permanently
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Unable to find web elements and find xpath is not working
entry.content:
Chrome Version :126.0.6425.0 (Official Build) (arm64) (cohort: Control) OS : Windows, Linux, Mac
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch chrome 2. Navigate to chrome://settings or chrome://history or chrome://downloads 3. Inspect the page 4. right click and copy the xpth 5. Ctrl+f and paste the xpath
What is the expected result? 1. Xpath should address the part of XML doc 2. Even the html tags are not addressing.
What happens instead? Xpath is not addressing the part.
This issue is seen from M-113 onwards, So Raising it as a NR Issue.
1. Issue is repro on latest Canary #126.0.6427.0, Beta #125.0.6422.4, Dev #125.0.6420.3 and Stable #123.0.6312.123
Kindly refer to the attached screen-cast.
Thanks..

entry.title: Unable to inspect the bookmarks page
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 126.0.6425.0 (Official Build) (arm64) (cohort: Control) OS : Windows, Linux, Mac
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch chrome 2. Navigate to chrome://bookmarks 3. Try to inspect the " To bookmark pages, click the star in the address bar" text
What is the expected result? All available elements should be inspectable.
What happens instead? Unable to inspect the " To bookmark pages, click the star in the address bar" text.
This issue is seen from M-113 onwards, So Raising it as a NR Issue.
1. Issue is repro on latest Canary #126.0.6427.0, Beta #125.0.6422.4, Dev #125.0.6420.3 and Stable #123.0.6312.123
Kindly refer to the attached screen-cast.
Thanks..

entry.title: Regression: Google doodle share option not proper
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 126.0.6427.0 (Official Build) canary (x86_64) 5c513a1b6e4bd664e87dae2bfb086e1c8b6bec5f-refs/branch-heads/6427@{#1}
OS: Mac,Win and Linux
Steps: 1. Launch chrome and open NTP 2. Go to Chrome webstore and apply any theme 3. Start play any video 4. Navigate to NTP 5. Observe share option for Google doodle is red and sign is also not visible properly
Actual: Share option is in Red color and share sign is not properly visible
Expected: Share option should not be in red and should be visible properly
Good Build: 125.0.6399.0 Bad Build: 125.0.6400.0
Change log URL: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/368018b8aaadcc727af6c53847f5934764450854..75c329cd2b116ed7b2f1ed29b084897d6df69e17
Suspect: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/3ae65ff2094feb956f2d7fc4a234144b11ee969c
@ Gemma: Could you please check whether this is caused with respect to your change, if not please help us in assigning it to the right owner.
Please find the attached screencast for reference. Good: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-lwAmHr2bpzJIl6ZXpAMtdIk6wcudKV8/view?usp=sharing Actual: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M_2zujXfox9GKsgc3Tie3pm9ORXCDgKv/view?usp=sharing
Note: 1. Issue is unable to repro on Stable#123.0.6312.124 2. Issue is repro on Beta #125.0.6422.4,Dev #125.0.6420.4 and Canary #126.0.6427.0
Thanks

entry.title: Regression:Tab focus is overlapping with the search line
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 126.0.6427.0 (Official Build) canary (x86_64) 5c513a1b6e4bd664e87dae2bfb086e1c8b6bec5f-refs/branch-heads/6427@{#1}
OS : Mac, Win(10,11), Linux
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch chrome and open NTP. 2. Goto chrome://setting . 3.Now click on “Privacy and security” option. 4.Now click on “Third-party cookies” option. 5.Now type any letter in the search and perform tab focus on the close button ‘X’. 6. Observe that the ‘Tab focus is overlapping with the search line’.
Actual Result: Tab focus is overlapping with the search line
Expected Result: Tab focus should not overlap with the search line
Please find bisect info below:
This is a regression issue broken in M120, and please find per revision-bisect info below:
Good Build : 119.0.6045.0 Bad Build : 120.0.6046.0
You are probably looking for a change made after 1259910 (known good), but no later than 1259911 (first known bad).
CHANGELOG URL:
The script might not always return single CL as suspect as some perf builds might get missing due to failure.
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/4c5f76f4c70049f99d75355eec642195c66d76b2..4c7912025a4a90c9663c07a47b831f1a37116661
Suspect: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4c7912025a4a90c9663c07a47b831f1a37116661
@Allen Bauer: Could you please check whether this is caused with respect to your change, if not please help us in assigning it to the right owner.
Note 1.Issue repro on latest Canary #126.0.6427.0 2.Issue repro on latest Dev #126.0.6423.0, Beta #125.0.6422.3 and Stable #124.0.6367.54 3.Issue is reproducible on Windows and Linux.
Kindly refer the screencast links attached below:
Good Build : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6AmKf4VAQQgigwd
Bad Build : https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjE5MTIwMDY0NTE1Mjc2OHwwNzI0ZGQ2My0xNg
Thanks!

entry.content:

# Problem Description ../../third_party/abseil-cpp/absl/time/internal/cctz/src/time_zone_libc.cc(51,10): error: unsafe buffer access [-Werror,-Wunsafe-buffer-usage] 51 | return _tzname[is_dst]; | ^~~~~~~ C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\include\10.0.22621.0\ucrt\time.h(88,17): note: expanded from macro '_tzname' 88 | #define _tzname (__tzname()) | ^~~~~~~~~~~~ ../../third_party/abseil-cpp/absl/time/internal/cctz/src/time_zone_libc.cc(51,10): note: See //docs/unsafe_buffers.md for help. C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\include\10.0.22621.0\ucrt\time.h(88,17): note: expanded from macro '_tzname' 88 | #define _tzname (__tzname()) | ^ 1 error generated.
# Summary Meet compile error: unsafe buffer access
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know

entry.title: Proper Tab focus not seen on text "service-worker.js" in Application Tab
entry.content:
Chrome Version:126.0.6427.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: M124 Rollout) 5c513a1b6e4bd664e87dae2bfb086e1c8b6bec5f-refs/branch-heads/6427@{#1}
OS : Win(10,11)
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1.Launch Chrome and Open NTP 2.Navigate to Amazon website(any website) 2.Right Click and then Inspect 3.Go to application Tab 4.Perform tab focus 5.Observe that,Proper Tab focus not seen on service-worker.js in Application Tab
Actual Result:Proper Tab focus not seen on service-worker.js in Application Tab Expected Result:Proper Tab focus should be seen on service-worker.js in Application Tab
This issue exists from M-118 Onwards.So,raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the Attached screencast below:
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Stable #123.0.6312.122, Dev #125.0.6395.3 and Beta RC#124.0.6367.28 2)As this being a Non-Regression issue,changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: AlphaDrop causing confusion
entry.content:
The alpha dropping feature which was added a few years ago saves power for effects use cases. Currently it's governed by heuristic logic in MediaStreamVideoSource which works like follows:
- If there are no tracks connected, alpha is dropped. - If there is any track with sinks that prefer alpha, alpha is kept. - Otherwise if there's any track with only video tile sinks, alpha is kept. - Otherwise, if there's a PeerConnection sink with 0 or more video sinks, alpha is dropped.
The logic has been causing some confusion internally, due to a couple of case types
1. it's magic that alpha gets dropped when PeerConnections are added 2. it's surprising that despite PeerConnections being added, another cloned track with a video tile causes alpha to be kept
There's been prior attempts to change the logic which got reverse committed due to breaking websited in the wild (see b/40248980).
I filed this issue to track improvements in making the feature work less surprisingly.

entry.title: onmessageerror IDL attribute missing on Worker
entry.content:
Per spec there should be an onmessageerror IDL attribute on Worker: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#dedicated-workers-and-the-worker-interface
According to https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/10262 the event can only fire in rare situations, and I'm not completely sure if it can ever fire in Blink. But if it can, we should add the onmessageerror IDL attribute.
